result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert D Singer #562426 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Copy given defendant, reading waived.

Defendant Albert D Singer in court with attorney David J W Klauser. Prosecuting Atty Thomas J. Fallon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Prel hrg held. MOPD Officer Brian Voltz sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Fallon. Witness identified defendant. Cross exam by Atty Klauser. Witness excused. No further witnesses. State moves for bindover. Atty Klauser objects to bindover. Court finds probable cause that the defendant committed a felony and ordered him boundover for further proceedings.
